Empire Today, LLC is an award winning home improvement company featuring quality name-brand carpet, flooring and window treatments. Our unique shop-at-home approach gives Sales Contractors the opportunity to make a difference and improve the daily lives of clients by helping them design their new living spaces.

As a company we are experiencing tremendous growth and are seeking dedicated, enthusiastic Outside Sales Contractors with an entrepreneurial drive! With average annual earnings at $50-$70K nationwide and top performers making over $100k, our independent Sales Contractors experience high rewards for strong performances.

Here's why Outside Sales Contractors (In-Home Sales) are eager to work with us:

Receive compensation while you learn the business.
Warm leads provided, freeing up time to network and uncover self-generated leads which equal an even higher financial reward.
100% commission based with unlimited earning potential.
High performance culture.
Higher commissions for hunters bringing in self-generated leads and cross-selling.
The support of Empire Today's strong, well-known brand and ongoing marketing efforts.
As an independent contractor, you decide how much you want to work.
As an Outside Sales Contractor (In Home Sales), you will be spending time with customers in their homes to determine their needs and discussing flooring options, while providing quality customer service.

We are looking for self-motivated, determined and focused talent, with professional sales experience, who embrace the challenges that come with responding to each customer's unique needs and desires. Communication, presentation, design and negotiating skills, where applicable, are utilized at each opportunity and offer exciting challenges to help transform a client's home while running your own business with the support of one of the strongest brands in home improvement - Empire Today.

Additional qualities of successful Outside Sales Contractors include:

Sales and design experience a plus, but not necessary
Must be ambitious and results oriented
Ability to network and self-generate a minimum of 2 sales per month
All Sales Contractors are independent 1099 contractors and are responsible for incorporating for themselves within 30 days if not already incorporated
Driver's license, auto insurance, and vehicle required

Please note this is a legitimate independent contractor position. There are no fees, and Brighten will never ask you for any money.
Location: NYC metro area
Contract Description:

Welcome to Brighten Communications. Interested in earning up to $18 per hour while working from the convenience of your own home? Brighten Communications gives you the opportunity to work whatever hours you want from 8 a.m. east coast time through 5 p.m. west coast time, Monday through Friday. You provide the phone, computer with internet access, and the pleasant voice...we provide the client base, flexible hours, and a great hourly wage.

About Brighten Communications:

Brighten Communications is a business-to-business telemarketing company specializing in the outsourcing of lead generation. The clients you will be making calls on behalf of represent professional organizations in industries such as finance, brokerage, and high-tech. Our goal is to provide our clients with the highest quality source of new leads for their product or service and to provide you with an enjoyable way to produce income right from your home, paid to you weekly.

Brighten Communications is headquartered in Phoenix, Arizona, and our corporate officers and board of directors have a lengthy history in management and marketing.

Requirements:

Brighten is looking for callers with previous telemarketing and cold calling experience.
High speed Internet access with a dependable computer running Windows 7,8, or 10 (sorry no Apple Macs,etc.).
You will need a good working phone line (no cell phones or Skype, but Vonage, RingCentral, etc, ok) and have an unlimited flat rate long distance plan on your phone.
You will need a quiet working environment.
You may work as few as 20 hours weekly or as many as 32. Hours available depend upon your stats and Brighten's workload.

Compensation / Pay:

You are paid weekly for the hours completed the previous week. The most common question asked of us is 'How can you pay me by the hour when I'm working from home ?'. The answer is that since we have so much experience in the industry and so many callers from across the nation calling each day, we know the approximate results you should get for each particular project. In addition all of your calls and activity is logged. The better you do, the higher your hourly reward can go.

Starting pay is $12 per hour which is the starting point where you will learn our system online and see how your calls compare to our other nationwide callers. After that, your hourly reward will be determined by your results from calls compared to the other members of the team nationwide. We have many callers that have been with us for years that earn up to $18 hourly.

Earnings are paid to you weekly as an independent contractor with a 1099 form at the end of the year. In addition, because you work as an independent contractor you may reap additional tax benefits and write offs. When you are chosen to work with our company you will get all of this information in writing so you can feel secure in what is expected of you and what the company will pay you.

If you wish to find out more or apply, please visit this link to our employment website. Applications are only accepted through the employment website listed below, so please do not call, email or fax resumes as they will be discarded.

Apply Online: https://www.brightenemployment.com/CallerInfo.aspx?s=cnyq&clid=165913931651&cat=cus&n=1

Become the Teacher You Imagine You Can Be!
Join the teaching team at Imagine Early Learning Centers.
Position: Pre-K Teacher/Assistant Director
Location: Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn
Imagine Early Learning Centers seeks a Full-time Teacher/Assistant
Director for our Pre-K classroom at our Brooklyn Heights location in
Brooklyn, NY. Our center is a safe, nurturing, fun and friendly
environment

We are seeking an experienced, energetic, and creative professional
looking to join a team providing the highest quality childcare for
working families. While you will primarily serve as a UPK teacher and
work in the classroom, this position will be a dual role and is perfect
for someone looking to move up and develop expertise in education
administration. Most importantly, we are seeking a head teacher who is NYS
Certified B-2.
Responsibilities include: 

Participating in planning and implementing developmentally
appropriate curriculum
Effective communication with families and co-teachers
Ability to adhere to licensing and NAEYC guidelines
Effective written communication skills
Ability to meet physical requirements of position which include
lifting children, pushing strollers/buggies, sitting on the floor and
year-round daily outdoor activities.

Competitive salaries and benefits including:

Paid Vacation and Sick Time
Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
Flexible spending accounts (FSA)
Supplemental Insurance (NY Life, Aflac)
Transit Chek (Commuter Benefit)
Tuition Reimbursement/Degree Incentive Reward
Educational support programs available
Childcare Discount where available
Professional Development

Additionally, in 2018 Imagine officially became an employee owned
company through the creation of an ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership
Plan). What this means is not only do we value and possess an ownership
culture, all qualified employees at Imagine receive a retirement
benefit without paying any contributions to the fund themselves. 

Qualifications


Minimum of BA in Early Childhood, Elementary, Special Education
or related field
NY State B-2 Certification REQUIRED
MA in Early Childhood, Elementary, Special Education or related
field, a plus
Previous experience teaching children in an Early Childhood
program
Previous experience with NAEYC standards and the accreditation
process a plus

Who We Are: 
Imagine Early Learning Centers, an employee owned child care
management company, operates ten high quality, full day licensed and
NAEYC accredited Early Childhood centers in the NY metro area for
children 6 weeks to 5-years-old. With state of the art facilities,
professional development opportunities for promotion, a teamwork
approach to classroom and center management, and a creative and
rewarding work environment, Imagine maintains a satisfied and talented
teacher staff. At Imagine, we know children, as well as staff and
families, thrive in a stimulating and nurturing environment. Staff,
children and families alike are valued as individuals and as members of
our diverse community.
Additional information

Imagine Early Learning Centers is an equal opportunity/affirmative
action employer and will not discriminate against any employee or
applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national
origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any
classification protected by federal, state, or local law.


Please apply online with Imagine Early Learning Centers at: https://imagineelc.hiringthing.com/job/67228/upk-teacher-assistant-director?s=cl

FIELD SALES & MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE - Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI) 

About Us: 

TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth. 
Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Homelite®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, Oreck ® and Vax®. 
TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you! 

Duties and Responsibilities: 
• Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTi products. 
• Maximize sell through of Ryobi®, Homelite®, and Milwaukee® brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. 
• Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. 
• Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTi Management, and The Home Depot. 
• Maintain regular contact with assigned Home Depot store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. 
• Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. 
• Participate in the Leadership Development Training Program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. 
• Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. 
• Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. 
• Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. 
• Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. 

Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality. 

Education and Experience Requirements 
• Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. 
• Valid driver's license required. 
• Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. 
• Ability to work nights and weekends. 
• Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. 
• Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. 

Salary: Starting at $42,500, plus quarterly bonus potential. Includes company vehicle + Phone + 401k & benefits.

Please send resume through reply link through Craigslist.
title: FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE -MILWAUKEE, HOOVER, RYOBI

- Capacity to be punctual and show up on time ALWAYS.
- Willing to work in the rain, snow, heat and humidity.
- Comfort with and ability to handle dogs of all sizes.
- Ability to commit to at least 6 months with our company.
- Have excellent written and spoken communication skills.
- Capacity to follow through with training techniques as advised by owners (positive reinforcement/reward based training only).
- Patience with our special needs dogs (pups that don't like to walk, pups that jump or pull, elderly dogs with medical issues). 
- Capability to work Monday - Friday 11am to 6pm
- You must have a cell phone with a contract.  It is very important that we can reach you at all times during work hours.

Respond with a cover letter and your resume.  
If you do not respond properly we will not contact you.

        The Conrad New York is currently hiring an Assistant Food & Beverage Manager at this award winning, AAA Four Diamond hotel located in the heart of Lower Manhattan. Named one of the ?Best Hotels in New York? by U.S. News & World Report, 2014 and 2015, the Conrad has won numerous travel industry awards and accolades since the hotel opened its doors.What will I be doing? As an Assistant Manager of Food and Beverage, you would be responsible for assisting in the daily management of activities and services of all hotel food and beverage operations (kitchens, restaurants, banquets, lounges, room service, coffee shops, etc.) in the hotel's continuing effort to deliver outstanding guest service and financial profitability. Specifically, you would be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standard:Assist in the management of all Food and Beverage operations to include, but not limited to, guest service, food and beverage quality, inventory management, outlet reservations and occupancy, systems management, budget and forecasting, marketing, report generation, department management and meeting participation and facilitationEnsure consistency in food quality and presentation and monitor cost and portion controlsAssist in monitoring and developing team member performance to include, but not limited to, providing supervision and professional development, scheduling, conducting counseling and evaluations and delivering recognition and rewardMeet and greet guests and respond to guest inquiries, requests and issues in a timely, friendly and efficient manner and resolve guest concernsMonitor and assess service and satisfaction trends, evaluate and address issues and make improvements accordinglyEnsure compliance with health, safety, sanitation and alcohol awareness standardsAssist in recruiting, interviewing and training team membersWhat are we looking for? Since being founded in 1919, Hilton has been a leader in the hospitality industry. Today, Hilton remains a beacon of innovation, quality, and success. This continued leadership is the result of our Team Members staying true to our Vision, Mission, and Values. Specifically, we look for demonstration of these Values:Hospitality - We're passionate about delivering exceptional guest experiences.Integrity - We do the right thing, all the time.Leadership - We're leaders in our industry and in our communities.Teamwork - We're team players in everything we do.Ownership - We're the owners of our actions and decisions.Now - We operate with a sense of urgency and disciplineIn addition, we look for the demonstration of the following key attributes:QualityProductivityDependabilityCustomer FocusAdaptabilityWhat will it be like to work for Hilton? Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For nearly a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travelers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision ?to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality? unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day. And, our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all!EOE/AA/Disabled/VeteransApply Now

We are presently looking for Marketing Reps. for our NEWARK location to be responsible for driving company profitability and growth while helping to manage sales teams to inform and educate our clients about reducing their environmental impact by going green.
Green energy (sometimes called renewable or sustainable energy) comes from natural sources like wind, water, and sunlight. Because green energy can be produced with little pollution, it's far more environmentally-friendly than other types of energy, and it doesn't contribute to climate change or global warming like traditional energy sources. Plus, unlike fossil fuels such as coal and oil, green energy sources are renewable, meaning they replenish naturally and are in continuous supply.

 You'll handle a high volume of calls, chats, and emails from existing customers, as well as people in tough lockout situations who need fast, safe, and reliable help. This role offers career skills development and a lot of room for growth within the company.

Summary
The Hospitality & Travel Services Assistant provides administrative support to the department, which includes Charitable Contributions, Travel, Corporate Card, Catering & Conference Services and Firm Events). The position will report to the Director of Hospitality & Travel Services, but may take guidance and direction from other managers within the team. 

A primary focus of the role is the coordination of Firm Charitable Contributions, with balance of role supporting the overall department.

Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS - 50%:
 Research new requests and provide prior history to Partner in charge.
 Process related invoices, prepare letters to organizations, provide copies to requesting Partners,
maintain thorough file for audit and tax purposes.
 Work with Graphics department to create Journal Ads as needed.
 Work with internal contacts to fill tables at Charitable events as needed.
 Track YTD spend and contributions

TRAVEL & CORPORATE CARD - 15%
 Monthly audit process to identify Air & Rail refunds to corporate cards (Access Database).
 Ongoing corporate card maintenance - Departing/arriving lawyers cardmember email notifications; deliver new cards upon arrival; cancel cards for departing cardmembers and update Amex Card profiles; ensure zero balances upon departure by notifying and communicating with cardmember.
 Track Membership Reward usage and firm savings (Access Database).
 Produce year-end Hotel Savings Report (Access Database).

CATERING & CONFERENCE SERVICES - 15%
 Processing and tracking related invoices.
 Maintain daily CMS reports, report high peaks in abandoned calls and RONA activity.
 Track weekly ad-hoc global MyConference requests from TCS.
 Run quarterly conference dining activity reports, compare YoY.
 Run Seamless reports for each department twice monthly.

FIRM EVENTS - 20%:
 Work with event planners to gather and maintain invitee lists for events as necessary, including combining/reformatting lists from multiple sources, eliminating duplicates, researching records
without email addresses or undeliverable.
 Configure and print name badges.
 Supporting the event team in tracking event calendar and spend in the Event Management System -
including:
o Entering event data and invoices in EMS
o Creating and running reports with various event statistics and spend
Supervisory responsibilities - N/A

Qualifications
 Candidate must be service-oriented, collegial and able to communicate effectively with all levels of
the Firm.
 Professional demeanor and strong written and verbal communication skills.
 Strong attention to detail, organizational, time management, and prioritization skills.
 Ability to work independently, meet multiple deadlines and respond well to change.
 Knowledge of general office support functions required.
 Technical Skills:
 Proficient in a range of computer software applications, including programs and databases
such as, MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint.
 Knowledge of SharePoint, Access and MS Publisher a plus.
 Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics or other contact management database preferred.
 Experience with Cvent Event Management software preferred.

Education and/or experience
Bachelor's Degree and a minimum of 2-3 years of work experience in a professional environment required. Law firm and/or financial services experience preferred.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

SAT/ACT Tutoring Part-Time with PrepScholar - Flexible Online Tutoring
Boston company PrepScholar is looking for talented tutors to teach the SAT and ACT. If you've mastered these tests, are an engaging teacher, want to be part of a growing startup, and have at least 15 hours per week to offer, we want you.
-----
Why Join Us:
+ Flexible Hours: We know that you might be busy as a graduate student or with other jobs. You have the flexibility to take on as much tutoring as you can handle.  While we request applicants with at least 15 hours to offer, you may take 40 hours of tutoring or more if you prefer.

+ Flexible Location: Your teaching will be done all online via Skype or similar software, with students across the country. Enjoy the flexibility of teaching anywhere that's convenient for you.

+ Great Pay: At PrepScholar, we believe that our tutoring is only as good as the teacher. We reward great teaching with great pay and routinely give bonus rates for great teaching.  Rates start at $30/hour and go up to $50/hour or more.

+ Technology-Enhanced Tutoring: Each of your students will be studying with our online prep product, which is a comprehensive program with over 1600 questions and adaptive technology. No need to prepare your own materials. 

+ Improve Your Teaching: We're passionate about high quality teaching and getting our students results. We'll guide you through our teaching philosophies and mentor you to become the best teacher you can be.

-----
About Us:
+ We're making education more effective through customization. We learn each student's strengths and weaknesses and create tailored learning programs through technology.

+ Our program has proven results that lead the prep industry, and tutoring makes it even better. 

+ We're passionate about delivering an unparalleled student experience. A lot of companies are trying smart education; almost none are doing it well.

+ Learn more at www.prepscholar.com

-----
We're Looking For:
+ 99%ile SAT or ACT score. 2300+ and 34+ preferred. You know the test inside and out.

+ Highly selective undergraduate or graduate institution preferred.

+ Great teaching skills. You understand how to identify weak points in a student's thinking. You know how to customize your teaching to the student and break down tough questions into concepts. You also know how to engage with and build rapport with students.

+ Serious commitment and reliability. You take great pride in your work and never phone it in. You always pull through and deliver. You're rarely the one late to a meeting.

+ College graduates preferred (undergrads can apply but you are expected to have consistent schedule openings).

+ At least 15 hours of availability every week to offer students. 

-----
Hourly Rate:
$30/hr to $50/hour or more.

We want to hear from you. 

To submit a full application to be a PrepScholar tutor, email with your cover letter, resume, SAT/ACT scores and any other standardized test scores (e.g. GRE, GMAT, LSAT). For verification of your scores, you can just send a screenshot of your online score report for now, with full verification upon starting.
title: SAT/ACT Tutoring Part-Time or Full Time - Flexible Online Tutoring

Trion Real Estate Management is a leading property management company and owner in NY and CT. At Trion we believe that we are only as good as our employees and we contribute our success, in large part, to them. Our employees work as a team, think "outside the box", and take pride in their position. Our goal is to reward their efforts with competitive pay, benefits, professional growth and development opportunities.

An immediate opportunity is available for a Property Manager with New York City experience. We are looking for someone that is looking to grow with our company. The position is available immediately and requires a 3+ years' experience in NYC or Westchester County property management. We require that this individual is well organized, personable and able to communicate well with a diverse group of people.

Job Description:

Oversee all building operations, maintenance services and outside contractors/vendors.
Attend all monthly and annual meetings
Direct Contact for all resident concerns or requests.
Assist in creating and maintaining the Annual budgets for each of the properties responsible for.
Approve all purchase orders to confirm all large purchases are necessary and accounted for.
Track and approve all maintenance work orders
Implement cost saving and revenue increasing initiatives
Perform weekly quality assurance inspections for each of the buildings to ensure onsite building staff is properly maintaining the site and curb appeal is immaculate.
Implement an in-depth review of the properties documents (By-Laws, House Rules, Offering Plans, & Proprietary Lease) to operate the properties in accordance with these legal documents.
Answer and appropriately direct concerned owner phone calls or inquiries to the proper management department for resolution.
Update all Property Handbooks annually and create annual calendars per building.
Handle emergency issues afterhours associated with properties.


Job Requirements:

Must have a minimum of 3+ years experience in property management.
Excellent verbal and written communication and customer service skills.
Must be a fast learner and a self-starter with the ability to problem solve.
Must be able to work independently, self-manage, and be extremely organized.
Valid driver's license and reliable transportation.


Qualifications:

Education: Bachelor's Degree. Additional Property management certificates are a plus.
Strong working knowledge of Excel, Word, and Outlook.
Yardi Voyager Property Management software knowledge is a plus.


What Trion Provides:

In house training and exposure to a diverse portfolio of properties across Westchester County, Connecticut, and NYC.
Opportunity to grow quickly.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Staten Island residents only please. NYC is too far a drive from our NJ location

Text Dave the owner at 973 647 7769

There is nothing more reliable than Plumbing, Heating and Air conditioning, they can't export a trade to India! LOL!!! The sky is the limit, maybe even own your own company someday! Our last "Salsy" Tech cleared 120K two years running before moving out of state to start his own business. Between his regular hourly pay, overtime pay and bonus/reward money he averaged $52 hr!

HVAC Technician "Golden Ticket" Opportunity! The free training alone is worth tens of thousands of dollars and a career in this field can bring you hundreds of thousands of dollars over the years! We have the Best trucks, Best people, Paid training, Fastest career path and Compensation. We keep our HVAC Techs busy year round, because our people are crossed trained do basic plumbing calls too! (HVAC Techs in trucks with Lead Plumbers in slow season) Some even go on to receive their Master Plumbers license! 

If you lie, cheat, steal or do hard drugs, please skip further reading this Craig's list post, as it's not for you. However, if you truly live a clean lifestyle, have life goals and would like to enjoy the benefits of working with an elite team where honesty, organization and good character thrive, please read on!

Being a great communicator is a requirement. Diagnosing, selling, repairing and servicing residential equipment a must. Your current employer WILL NOT be contacted. At Good Tidings, we understand your desire to not waste time with interviews that are not likely to pan out. Why get dressed up and drive to a business location, only to spend even more time being paraded around the office? There's a better way!

With the convenience of your laptop, you can now "Interview" from the comfort and privacy of your home. If you want a career where you can make more money and leave the daily frustrations of your current job behind, then why not accept my invitation by clicking this link? http://goodtidings.applybyweb.com (Click the Technician / Plumber tab)

To get the most attention, text or call the owner at 973 647 7769 

Visit:
www.goodtidingscomfort.com
www.facebook.com/GoodTidingsComfort
https://youtu.be/fJRjZyjQfBA

We're currently searching for a great communicator who is interested in getting more out of life; more time off, more money, more career opportunity, more training, more support, more appreciation and more fulfillment. We are looking for someone who can appreciate the work/life balance that our company can deliver for them.

Quote from one employe:
"I started working a few months ago, came in with no experience and they welcomed me with opened arms. They are more than willing to teach and accommodate my learning curve. Everyone from the office to the warehouse and the Technicians are all a big family. The guys in the field really get along together, want to see each other succeed and its great to be around that environment. I enjoy working here; it's a real family atmosphere. Also, learning from these Technicians that are such masters or their craft is something to strive for!"
~ Steve P

Better yet, here is what Adam had to share:
Less than 2 years ago I started with Good Tidings and now I am on my way to becoming a full technician. I'm so excited, I just returned from a week of paid sales and customer service training in California and I'm looking forward to using my new skills! The motivation, training and pay increases come along with every step of the way, and you are most certainly not alone when help is needed because we are a team. All the technicians and office staff are like a second family and everyone is there to help out if the going gets tuff. I couldn't have pictured a better environment to learn and grow in this trade, and for that I am truly grateful. 
~ Adam M.

OK, this next part is ONLY for you Doubting Thomas's out there.

I've been hearing from some applicants lately who took years before reaching out to me. They were thinking the Craig's list ad was too good to be true and likely the work of a recruiter. A positive, straight forward, honest, cutting edge Plumbing, Heating and Air-conditioning company here in NJ? Applicants quickly expressed their relief after speaking with me and wished they'd reached out sooner, instead of wrongly thinking that the ad was the product of some scam. 

Worse yet, they might have been thinking I was like the big, unethical, money hungry, state wide, corporate owned, get away with whatever I can, "Teach and reward my people for lying", soon to be in the papers and speaking and with the Attorney General for ripping off the elderly, type of company (Can you tell how I feel just yet?).

In an effort to get ahead of these thoughts, please know that I am a very real family man, a 2nd generation Master Plumber, HVAC businessman and license holder. I built my company from scratch, and i care about my company, its people and my customers, enormously. 

I'm honest, ethical, integrity filled and unafraid. The cost of which, in the past, going through peak times with trucks sitting idle and the office turning lots of work away. Why turn all of that work and money away??? Because it was the right thing to do, in light of the lack of quality and character of the available workmen, which was way below what my customers expected and deserved for their hard-earned money. It's hard for most people to believe, but I value my faith and integrity above profits.

For you sceptics out there, I'm climbing out on a limb here, by sharing a very personal account of faith in the workplace. My goal is to put away any doubt or speculation out of your mind and have you see for yourself, what it's been like NOT to be held captive by money and to do the "right thing" in business, no matter what the cost. To God be the glory

https://youtu.be/BZZQkxULXAo

Honesty matters
~ Dave
29 years of faith filled family service!

Location: Nosara, Costa Rica

Want to make serious money while living in paradise? If you're a beach lover who gets satisfaction from selling a genuine product you can be proud of, with the potential of making $175,000+ annually, you've found your dream career.   

JOB Description: 
Consultative Face-to-Face Sales Representative for our unmatched home ownership opportunity on the Gold Coast of Costa Rica. No need to search for clients. We provide you with a continual supply of clients who have put down a deposit to tour our homes and community.

Are you an experienced opener and closer?
Do you have experience selling face-to-face?
Are you interested in earning top commissions?
Do you understand the difference between Consultative Sales Vs. High-pressure Sales?
Do you have what it takes to earn $175,000+ annually?

No Real Estate Experience? No problem. We will train you the RIGHT, EASY WAY.
Kalia Luxury Living is a Top Award-Winning Homebuilder, in Costa Rica's leading sustainable estate communities on the pristine Pacific "Gold Coast" - with breathtaking ocean views. We're one of the most unique homebuilders in the country and our award-winning home designs have gained international recognition. While you may not know us, you probably may have heard of our brand. We construct the finest new homes in Central America.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
COMMISSIONED FACE-TO-FACE SALES REPRESENTATIVE - NOSARA, COSTA RICA
As a member of the Kalia Sales Team your goal is simple, to sell homes in our upscale resort-style community, offering the best lifestyle and value unmatched anywhere else in Central America! After a comprehensive training program designed to maximize your success, you will be assigned to work in our beautiful model home communities.
Our mission is to provide a superior sales experience that will create loyal Kalia Homeowners. No real estate license is required! Bring your successful sales skills to a new level.

Qualified applicants should have a professional appearance. High-energy, positive, out-going, friendly individuals with strong verbal communication skills WILL succeed as a Sales Associate at Kalia Luxury Living.

The right candidate for this position will be a results-driven individual who can use a consultative sales strategy to effectively understand our customer's needs, communicate the value of our product and continuously close new business.
Specific areas of responsibility will include:

Influence the sales process and home-buying decision
Build excitement and urgency for the customer
Maintain the overall image of Kalia's award-winning model homes and community
Communicate value to our buyers through in-depth needs analysis
Demonstrate and tour the model homes and available home sites
Dine and wine with the clients
Utilize your strong closing techniques in order to make the sale
Review blueprints and site plans
Pre-qualify buyers for financing
Present purchase agreements
Establish and maintain long-term relationships with clients
Use your creative ability to initiate referrals

CORPORATE TRAINING
Sales Training Program will consist of hands-on learning, supplemented with extensive training on the job and in the employee's Division. Our program is designed so that within a maximum of 21 days you will be on your own making money and selling at your best potential.

QUALIFICATIONS
The ideal sales candidate will have:

Real estate sales experience (with excellent closing records) 
Three+ years of demonstrated, successful sales experience.
Excellent leadership skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Strong closing skills.
High degree of emotional intelligence.
Strong problem solving and communication skills.
Current Driver's License.

As an employee of an industry leader, we reward you with:
Excellent Earnings and Strong Commission Opportunities (Average representative can make $175,000+ per year)
Outstanding Career Growth Potential 
Vacations and Holidays
Home Purchase Discount

It takes a strong team to build a successful company; now build your dream career with us.
title: Sales Rep for Luxury Coastal Community. Face-to-face.

Each meal is nutritionally designed to contain the optimal amount of plant-based protein, hydrating fresh produce and nutrient-dense superfoods to help balance, restore and heal the body, so our clients can look and feel their absolute best.  

We are currently seeking passionate, positive and hardworking team players to join our kitchen. We are a performance-based culture and reward hard work and exceptional results with competitive compensation and opportunities for growth. 

Requirements:
•	Must be at least 18 years old
•	Must be eligible to work in the U.S. 
•	Must be able to work weekends, holiday and overtime as required
•	At least 1 year of related experience preferred
•	Comfortable working in a fast-paced warehouse and kitchen environment with strict deadlines
•	Must be able to stand and/or sit for extended periods of time, with or without reasonable accommodation
•	Exposure to refrigerated or freezer space for extended periods of time
•	Excellent "can-do" attitude, strong work ethic, and great team spirit
•	Must be able to bend and lift up to 49 pounds 
•	Ability to work in multiple roles throughout kitchen and warehouse
•	Must satisfactorily complete a background check upon conditional offer

Job Functions:
•	Assembling, labeling, and packaging meals and customer packages in a cold pack room
•	Cooking and food prep tasks including: cleaning, chopping, cooking vegetables and fruit, making sauces, baking, etc.
•	Portioning soups, sauces, dressings
•	Performing daily kitchen/warehouse maintenance and cleaning tasks

What you get:
•	Competitive hourly wages
•	Health and dental benefits
•	Paid sick leave and vacation
•	Excellent opportunity for advancement at a growing company

Sakara Life is an equal opportunity employer

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $13.00 to $15.00 /hour

Please send along a copy of your resume for review.

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Seasonal Tennis Pro Shop Assistant (Light court and facility maintenance) at Richmond County Country Club, Staten Island, NY

***HIRING NOW***

TENNIS BACKGROUND Preferred

2018 Seasonal Tennis Pro Shop Assistant (we close in October)
Compensation: $13/hour 
Employment type: part-time 

TENNIS BACKGROUND Preferred 

TENNIS JOB OPENING 
Prefer tennis playing or working background. Must be available to work shifts between 7:30AM-9PM Monday-Sunday in Summer and after school during the school year.  Must be available and egger to work all summer.  We are looking for someone who is professional and who constantly works to make the Club environment a better place. This job is busy and an active outgoing person is required. Must like working hard and finding ways to improve our Club.

Job entails handling incoming phone calls, making calls to promote events, answer questions and lesson appointments. Tennis assistant will groom our tennis courts and perform light cleaning/maintenance jobs. The position requires a professional, friendly and outgoing personality and a neat appearance. Our work environment is busy and there is frequent tasks are needed to be performed by the tennis assistants. Must have computer knowledge. Having experience in the service industry preferred as well as tennis playing or working experience. Applicants who are outgoing, well groomed, and available weekdays and weekends are well suited for this position. No phone calls please. Please list any tennis background when applying.

We are looking for a very strong workers who knows how to deal with member needs and who will help out whenever they can. Having a background in tennis is very helpful to understand the environment here.

Must be able to lift up to 80 pounds at times.

We have two shifts per day.  NOTE: With fall and spring schedules, we alter the schedule a bit due to limited hours of play as we have no tennis court lights. We will be closing for the season in October and strong employees will be invited to return in the spring of 2019.

Staff here need to be focused on member service and keeping the place as clean and stocked up with various supplies and amenities for members as possible.

We reward the hardest workers with more hours, higher pay, and future employment. We are seeking to find regular staff to help over the next few years if possible.

NOTE: Applicants will NOT be contacted unless a short letter of interest is included and addressed to Scott Nagle. This will help ensure that interested candidates receive the most attention.


    Principals only. Recruiters, please don't contact this job poster.
    do NOT contact us with unsolicited services or offers
title: Tennis Office Assistant+Court Care+Light Maintenance+Food Service

KeyMe is a New York City startup revolutionizing the locksmith industry with innovative robotics and mobile technology.

Description



We've raised $105 million to date from top-tier investors, include Comcast Ventures, Battery Ventures, 7-Eleven, and White Star Capital.
About the Role:
KeyMe's Customer Service team is the public face of a fast-growing key-copying and locksmith startup.
 You'll handle a high volume of calls, chats, and emails from existing customers, as well as people in tough lockout situations who need fast, safe, and reliable help. This role offers career skills development and a lot of room for growth within the company.
Requirements:

At least 1 year in a customer service role. Startup experience not required! Retail, hospitality, etc. are great backgrounds for this role.
Availability for evening and weekend shifts (please indicate your availability in the Q&A).
Fluency in Spanish and English is preferred, but not required.
Prior experience in an office environment a plus, but not required.
Experience handling a high volume of calls and emails from customers or clients a plus.
Sales experience is relevant as well.
Experience using Zendesk, Talkdesk, and/or Google Docs a plus.
Genuine empathy and tough skin!

Benefits:

Health, dental, and vision insurance.
Flexible Spending Account (FSA).
Health Savings Account (HSA).
Snacks and drinks in the office!
KeyMe Fun Activities Committee (KFAC).
401K plan and stock options.
Paid Time Off and Commuter Benefits.
Monthly team contests to reward top performers!











KeyMe is revolutionizing the locksmith industry with innovative robotics and mobile technology. They're hiring Customer Service Associates with at least 1 year of customer service experience -- retail, hospitality, and other backgrounds welcome! You'll handle a high volume of calls, chats, and emails from existing customers as well as people in tough lockout situations who need fast, safe, and reliable help. Candidates bilingual in English and Spanish are especially encouraged to apply!






To View this Job and Apply: Click Here

Powered by Planted, where young professionals find awesome jobs at high-growth startups. Learn more about Planted on our website and in the New York Times.

Job Description

Become the Teacher You Imagine You Can Be!
Join the teaching team at Imagine Early Learning Centers, an
Employee Owned Company.
Position: Assistant Teacher
Location: Upper East Side, Manhattan
Imagine Early Learning Centers seeks a Full-Time Assistant
Teacher for our childcare center located on the Upper East
Side. Our center is a safe, nurturing, fun and friendly environment.
Classroom ages run from infant to PreK.
We are seeking an experienced, energetic and creative professional
to join a team providing the highest quality childcare for working
families. 
Responsibilities include: 

Participating in planning and implementing developmentally
appropriate curriculum
Effective communication with families and co-teachers
Ability to adhere to licensing and NAEYC guidelines
Effective written communication skills
Ability to meet physical requirements of position which include
lifting children, pushing strollers/buggies, sitting on the floor and
year-round daily outdoor activities.

Competitive salaries and benefits including:

Paid Time Off (Vacation and Sick)
Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage
Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Retirement Benefits (Employee Stock Ownership Plan)
Supplemental Insurance (NY Life, Aflac)
Transit Chek
Tuition Reimbursement/Degree Incentive Reward
Educational Support Programs available
Childcare Discount where available
Professional Development

Additionally, in 2018 Imagine officially became an employee owned
company through the creation of an ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership
Plan). What this means is not only do we value and possess an ownership
culture, all qualified employees at Imagine receive a retirement
benefit without paying any contributions to the fund themselves.

Qualifications


Minimum of CDA or AA in Early Childhood, Elementary, Special
Education or related field required (or in progress)
Previous experience teaching children in an Early Childhood
program required
BA in Early Childhood, Elementary, Special Education or related
field a plus
Previous experience with NAEYC standards and the accreditation
process preferred

Who We Are 
Imagine Early Learning Centers, an employee owned child care
management company, operates ten high quality, full day licensed and
NAEYC accredited Early Childhood centers in the NY metro area for
children 6 weeks to 5-years-old. With state of the art facilities,
professional development opportunities for promotion, a teamwork
approach to classroom and center management, and a creative and
rewarding work environment, Imagine maintains a satisfied and talented
teacher staff. At Imagine, we know children, as well as staff and
families, thrive in a stimulating and nurturing environment. Staff,
children and families alike are valued as individuals and as members of
our diverse community.
Additional information

Imagine Early Learning Centers is an equal opportunity/affirmative
action employer and will not discriminate against any employee or
applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, national
origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any
classification protected by federal, state, or local law.


Please apply online with Imagine Early Learning Centers at: https://imagineelc.hiringthing.com/job/61670/assistant-teacher-early-childhood?s=cl

NoHo Hospitality Group Is Hiring an Office Administrator!


NoHo Hospitality Group owns and operates some of the country's most talked about and beloved restaurants helmed by James Beard award-winning chef Andrew Carmellini and partners Josh Pickard and Luke Ostrom. Properties include: Locanda Verde, The Dutch, Joe's Pub, The Library at The Public, Lafayette, Bar Primi, Little Park, Evening Bar, Westlight, Mister Dips, and Leuca all located in New York City, as well as The Dutch in Miami Beach and Rec Pier Chop House and The Cannon Room in Baltimore.


The Office Administrator supervises and coordinates all administrative activities for NoHo Hospitality Group Headquarters. Aptitude for administration, organization, clear communication and follow through on tasks in accordance with NoHo Hospitality Group company vision and standards is essential.


Responsibilities: 
*Day-to-day office operations, maintenance and organization. 
*Manage the reception area to ensure effective telephone and email communications both internally and externally. 
*Provide office guests with a hospitable experience. 
*Purchase office supplies, furniture and office equipment for office. 
*Book travel arrangements for partners and operations team. 
*Participate as needed in special office projects.


Requirements: 
*Bilingual (English/Spanish)
*Outstanding organizational, communication and time-management skills. 
*Detail-oriented, excellent multi-tasking abilities. 
*A warm and friendly delivery while welcoming guests to the office. 
*Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office.


Benefits:
We offer medical, dental, and vision benefits after 90 days of employment for full time employees, as well as a 401(k), Paid Time Off, Employee Dining Discount, Zip Car Discount, Spa Discount, TransitChek, Corporate Fitness Program, Continuing Education Classes and Referral Reward Program.

QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
FIELD SALES & MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE - Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI) 

About Us: 

TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth. 
Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Homelite®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, Oreck ® and Vax®. 
TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you! 

Duties and Responsibilities: 
•	Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTi products. 
•	Maximize sell through of Ryobi®, Homelite®, and Milwaukee® brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. 
•	Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. 
•	Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTi Management, and The Home Depot. 
•	Maintain regular contact with assigned Home Depot store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. 
•	Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. 
•	Participate in the Leadership Development Training Program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. 
•	Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. 
•	Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. 
•	Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. 
•	Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. 

Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality. 

Education and Experience Requirements 
•	Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. 
•	Valid driver's license required. 
•	Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. 
•	Ability to work nights and weekends. 
•	Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. 
•	Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. 


Salary: Starting at $42,500, plus quarterly bonus potential. Includes company vehicle + Phone + 401k & benefits.

If interested, please send resume to Thomas.kentouris@ttigroupna.com
title: FIELD SALES REPRESENTATIVE -MILWAUKEE, HOOVER, RYOBI

TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you! 

Duties and Responsibilities: 
•	Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTi products. 
•	Maximize sell through of Ryobi®, Homelite®, and Milwaukee® brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. 
•	Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. 
•	Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTi Management, and The Home Depot. 
•	Maintain regular contact with assigned Home Depot store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. 
•	Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. 
•	Participate in the Leadership Development Training Program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. 
•	Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. 
•	Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. 
•	Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. 
•	Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. 

Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality. 

Education and Experience Requirements 
•	Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. 
•	Valid driver's license required. 
•	Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. 
•	Ability to work nights and weekends. 
•	Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. 
•	Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. 


Salary: Starting at $42,500, plus quarterly bonus potential.  Includes company vehicle + Phone + 401k & benefits.

If interested, please send resume to Thomas.kentouris@ttigroupna.com

body:
QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Staten Island residents only please. NYC is too far a drive from our NJ location

Text Dave the owner at 973 647 7769

There is nothing more reliable than Plumbing, Heating and Air conditioning, they can't export a trade to India! LOL!!! The sky is the limit, maybe even own your own company someday! Our last "Salsy" Tech cleared 120K two years running before moving out of state to start his own business. Between his regular hourly pay, overtime pay and bonus/reward money he averaged $52 hr!

HVAC Technician "Golden Ticket" Opportunity! The free training alone is worth tens of thousands of dollars and a career in this field can bring you hundreds of thousands of dollars over the years! We have the Best trucks, Best people, Paid training, Fastest career path and Compensation. We keep our HVAC Techs busy year round, because our people are crossed trained do basic plumbing calls too! (HVAC Techs in trucks with Lead Plumbers in slow season) Some even go on to receive their Master Plumbers license! 

If you lie, cheat, steal or do hard drugs, please skip further reading this Craig's list post, as it's not for you. However, if you truly live a clean lifestyle, have life goals and would like to enjoy the benefits of working with an elite team where honesty, organization and good character thrive, please read on!

Being a great communicator is a requirement. Diagnosing, selling, repairing and servicing residential equipment a must. Your current employer WILL NOT be contacted. At Good Tidings, we understand your desire to not waste time with interviews that are not likely to pan out. Why get dressed up and drive to a business location, only to spend even more time being paraded around the office? There's a better way!

With the convenience of your laptop, you can now "Interview" from the comfort and privacy of your home. If you want a career where you can make more money and leave the daily frustrations of your current job behind, then why not accept my invitation by clicking this link? http://goodtidings.applybyweb.com (Click the Technician / Plumber tab)

To get the most attention, text or call the owner at 973 647 7769 

Visit:
www.goodtidingscomfort.com
www.facebook.com/GoodTidingsComfort
https://youtu.be/fJRjZyjQfBA

We're currently searching for a great communicator who is interested in getting more out of life; more time off, more money, more career opportunity, more training, more support, more appreciation and more fulfillment. We are looking for someone who can appreciate the work/life balance that our company can deliver for them.

Quote from one employe:
"I started working a few months ago, came in with no experience and they welcomed me with opened arms. They are more than willing to teach and accommodate my learning curve. Everyone from the office to the warehouse and the Technicians are all a big family. The guys in the field really get along together, want to see each other succeed and its great to be around that environment. I enjoy working here; it's a real family atmosphere. Also, learning from these Technicians that are such masters or their craft is something to strive for!"
~ Steve P

Better yet, here is what Adam had to share:
Less than 2 years ago I started with Good Tidings and now I am on my way to becoming a full technician. I'm so excited, I just returned from a week of paid sales and customer service training in California and I'm looking forward to using my new skills! The motivation, training and pay increases come along with every step of the way, and you are most certainly not alone when help is needed because we are a team. All the technicians and office staff are like a second family and everyone is there to help out if the going gets tuff. I couldn't have pictured a better environment to learn and grow in this trade, and for that I am truly grateful. 
~ Adam M.

OK, this next part is ONLY for you Doubting Thomas's out there.

I've been hearing from some applicants lately who took years before reaching out to me. They were thinking the Craig's list ad was too good to be true and likely the work of a recruiter. A positive, straight forward, honest, cutting edge Plumbing, Heating and Air-conditioning company here in NJ? Applicants quickly expressed their relief after speaking with me and wished they'd reached out sooner, instead of wrongly thinking that the ad was the product of some scam. 

Worse yet, they might have been thinking I was like the big, unethical, money hungry, state wide, corporate owned, get away with whatever I can, "Teach and reward my people for lying", soon to be in the papers and speaking and with the Attorney General for ripping off the elderly, type of company (Can you tell how I feel just yet?).

In an effort to get ahead of these thoughts, please know that I am a very real family man, a 2nd generation Master Plumber, HVAC businessman and license holder. I built my company from scratch, and i care about my company, its people and my customers, enormously. 

I'm honest, ethical, integrity filled and unafraid. The cost of which, in the past, going through peak times with trucks sitting idle and the office turning lots of work away. Why turn all of that work and money away??? Because it was the right thing to do, in light of the lack of quality and character of the available workmen, which was way below what my customers expected and deserved for their hard-earned money. It's hard for most people to believe, but I value my faith and integrity above profits.

For you sceptics out there, I'm climbing out on a limb here, by sharing a very personal account of faith in the workplace. My goal is to put away any doubt or speculation out of your mind and have you see for yourself, what it's been like NOT to be held captive by money and to do the "right thing" in business, no matter what the cost. To God be the glory

https://youtu.be/BZZQkxULXAo

Honesty matters
~ Dave
29 years of faith filled family service!
title: HVAC Techs NOT getting enough hours? Up to $40 Hr. year round!

QR Code Link to This Post
            
        
Since 2012 ICN Group, a mother company of Dream IT, has transformed tens of thousands of careers through providing various services like global internship programs, corporation visit, job placement, and language training. As the whole world changes fast in many ways and requires new human resource that can serve the fast pace society, we have recently established Dream IT, a vocational training school, where today's most in-demand skills are learned.  The mission of Dream IT is to provide our students the tools to build a better life through a high quality technical and workforce-readiness education in a structured environment that will ensure their success. 

We're looking for competent program director & experienced instructors in our Midtown Manhattan location. Successful candidates will have a well-rounded background in subject courses:  
1.	Web Programming  
2.	Database Management & Analysis  
3.	Digital Marketing  
4.	E-Commerce  
5.	Mobile Development  

You should have experience of teaching one of these subjects

Requirements
•	Have working knowledge of Competency Based Education
•	Understanding the best practices associated with online pedagogy and course design
•	Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
•	Critical thinking and problem solving
•	Ability to create effective lesson plans
•	Manage student data-tracking database
•	Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of solving problems.
•	Ability to work effectively with a diverse population
•	Support students as they drive their own continued learning beyond the curriculum
•	Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community
•	Must be able to commute 

Education / Experience 
•	Master's degree in computer related majors
•	Preference will be given to PhD candidates with majors related to the subject areas above
•	Three years minimum hands on experience & teaching
•	5 years in leadership role in related area (director) 

Dream IT offers competitive compensation in the market. 
Send your resume with a cover letter to jimmyj@icncareer.com

Sakara Life is a rapidly growing organic meal delivery company headquartered in NYC, with kitchens in Brooklyn and Los Angeles. Our organic meal delivery program is based on the science behind a whole-food, plant-rich diet. Each meal is nutritionally designed to contain the optimal amount of plant-based protein, hydrating fresh produce and nutrient-dense superfoods to help balance, restore and heal the body, so our clients can look and feel their absolute best.  

We are currently seeking passionate, positive and hardworking team players to join our team. We are a performance-based culture and reward hard work and exceptional results with competitive compensation and opportunities for growth. 

Requirements:
•	Must be at least 18 years old
•	Must be eligible to work in the U.S. 
•	Must be able to work weekends, holiday and overtime as required
•	At least 1 year of related experience preferred
•	Comfortable working in a fast-paced warehouse and kitchen environment with strict deadlines
•	Excellent "can-do" attitude, strong work ethic, and great team spirit
•	Must be able to bend and lift up to 49 pounds 
•	Must satisfactorily complete a background check upon conditional offer

Job Functions:
•	Receive all orders, update receiving log, liaise with managers to ensure order is put away properly
•	Complete daily organization of our warehouse space, walkin coolers, and freezer
•	Operate a pallet lifter and pallet jacks
•	Perform daily kitchen/warehouse maintenance and cleaning tasks

What you get:
•	Competitive hourly wages
•	Health and dental benefits
•	Paid sick leave and vacation
•	Excellent opportunity for advancement at a growing company

Sakara Life is an equal opportunity employer

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $13.00 to $15.00 /hour

CLIENT GROWTH SPECIALIST

Due to rapid growth and increased demand, we are looking to hire a Client Growth Specialist onto our team who enjoys speaking with people and has a talent for presenting our company's products and services.  As a Client Growth Specialist, you will have opportunities for ongoing development in the company and a great team supporting you in the sales processes. You will receive training on our products and their content, packaging, and pricing to convey to your clients. The more you sell, the greater your rewards will be. The ideal candidate will have a great work ethic, sales experience, and a desire to win. This exciting position will maximize your sales skills and provide substantial financial rewards.

We offer a competitive base salary, as well as commission and bonuses on a weekly basis.

Job Description and Requirements:
•	Building relationships with executives and professionals
•	Assisting members in gathering new and updated biographical information for our database of 1.5 million people
•	Offer products and services to executives and professionals online to increase their credibility and visibility 
•	No Cold Calling - Only calling new applicants or existing customers
•	You will receive a huge client base to call
•	Professional verbal communication skills
•	Minimum of 3 years of proven track record of successful consumer sales is preferred 
•	Strong independent drive, negotiation and problem-solving skills
•	Ability to research, retain and build relationships with clients. 
•	Converse with business professionals on any level.
•	Time management and organizational skills

Compensation:
•	Annual base salary $45,000
•	Lucrative commissions along with daily, weekly & monthly bonuses and incentives for hitting certain targets
•	Average Client Growth Specialist is making between $75,000- $100,000
•	Medical benefits including dental, visions and 401k

Since 1898, Marquis Who's Who has remained the standard for reliable and comprehensive biographical data. Our first publication was released 118 years ago: Who's Who in America. Our database is in every public library and university in the United States.
Marquis Who's Who publications presents unmatched coverage of the lives of today's leaders and achievers from both the United States and around the world, from every significant field of endeavor. Engineers, Accountants, Lawyers, Politicians, Healthcare Leaders, students, researchers, corporate executives, journalists, personnel recruiters, and many others rely on Marquis Who's Who every day for in-depth biographical information they can use with confidence.
Over the course of decades, the needs of our patrons have evolved; we have strived to develop new and more convenient ways of providing access to our biographical data while maintaining its quality. While we continue the time-honored tradition of publishing our print publications, we are excited to introduce Marquis Biographies Online, a powerful, web product that offers real-time access to our database of over one million biographies! Once they have converted on line from print, other products are available for our members. Some are: Websites creations, Press Releases (that we optimize to major search engines,) magazine spreads, Legacy Family /Career Videos, Private newsletters, Humanitarian awards, and many more.  Our in house Editorial Staff creates these products under strict deadlines.  
For over 118 years Marquis Who's Who has opened doors and enabled professionals to reach their career goals, by highlighting their achievements through personalized online and print branding and marketing tools and resources
